name: Matteo Ricci

locations.description: Jesuit missionary to China, established mission in Beijing

summary: Matteo Ricci was an Italian Jesuit priest and one of the founding figures of the Jesuit China missions. He learned Chinese and adopted Chinese customs, becoming the first European to enter the Forbidden City of Beijing. He introduced Western science, mathematics, and astronomy to China while attempting to present Christianity in terms compatible with Chinese culture. His approach influenced the Chinese Rites Controversy.
